alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clay; Lowndes; Montgomery; Oktibbeha; Webster (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 29 at 9:47PM CST until November 30 at 3:45AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Choctaw County in central Mississippi... Central Montgomery County in north central Mississippi... Webster County in north central Mississippi... Clay County in northeastern Mississippi... Northeastern Lowndes County in northeastern Mississippi... Northern Oktibbeha County in northeastern Mississippi... * Until 345 AM CST. * At 947 PM CST, After a break in the rainfall, doppler radar indicates thunderstorms producing heavy rain approaching and moving back into the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the next few hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Starkville, Columbus, West Point, Montpelier, Columbus AFB, Eupora, Caledonia, Maben, Kilmichael, Mathiston, Cumberland, Clarkson, Pheba, Sherwood, Griffith, Bellefontaine, Pala Alto, Embry, Muldrow and Tibbee. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Choctaw; Clay; Lowndes; Montgomery; Oktibbeha; Webster
